div.sent: This war is known as the Liberation War.
The free state of Bangladesh was born by winning this war.
The Liberation War continued for nine months.
But there is a long history behind the Liberation War.
We shall now try to know about it.
Pakistan was divided in two parts, East Pakistan and West Pakistan.
Bangladesh at that time was known as East Pakistan.
The majority of the population of Pakistan lived in East Pakistan.
East Pakistan was also more resourceful.
But the supreme power lay in the hands of the non-Bengali West Pakistanis.
As a result the people of West Pakistan used to enjoy more facilities.
They used to exploit and oppress the people of East Pakistan in various ways.
Instantly after the birth of Pakistan steps were taken to make Urdu the stale language.
This organisation held various meetings and conferences for the purpose.
Bangla was the mother tongue of about 56% of the population of Pakistan.
In other words, Bangla was the mother tongue of the people of East Pakistan.
The students present there at once rejected it shouting, No! No!.
By and by the demand for making Bangla the state language grew stronger and stronger.
Council for Fighting for State Language was formed in Dhaka.
Different programmes including hartals were undertaken.
The Language Movement reached its culmination in 1952.
The Prime Minister of then Pakistan Khawaja Nazimuddin declared Urdu as the State Language.
The student community of East Pakistan promptly rejected this declaration.
They decided to observe 21 February, 1952 as the State Language Day.
The government tried to crush the movement.
On 21 February Section 144 was imposed forbidding processions and demonstrations.
But the students decided to violate Section 144.
They began to assemble inside the Dhaka University premises from morning on 21 February.
Police used tear gas shells to disperse them.
At one point of time, police opened fire on them.
Many including Salam, Barkat, Rafiq, Jabbar were martyred.
At this incidence, the people of whole of East Pakistan rose in protest.
This is our central Shahid Minar.
Imitating this, many Shahid Minars have been built in different educational institutions in the country.
Shahid Day or the Language Martyrs Day is a very important day for us.
This is one of our National Days.
Every year the people of Bangladesh observe 21 February as Shahid Day with profound respect.
Various functions are arranged on Shahid Day all over the country.
We shall also organise functions in the schools.
Language Movement played a major role in our Liberation War.
Through the Language Movement the spirit of nationalism grew in the people of East Pakistan.
This spirit worked as an inspiration for our War of Liberation in 1971.
These Movements worked as the background of the War of Liberation of Bangladesh.

Strong movements were started all over East Pakistan to realise these demands.
This Movement is known as the Six Points Movement.
Students Movements were organised against the Agartala Conspiracy Case.
This Movement made significant contribution to our liberation struggle.
But instead of giving in Ayub Khan pursued his repressive policies.
There was clash with police.
School student Matiur and worker Rustam were killed by the shots fired by police.
The situation in East Pakistan went beyond the control of the government.
In the meantime severe agitation went on in East Pakistan.
At one stage the agitation turned into mass revolution.
Immediately after receiving power Yahya Khan imposed Martial Law in the country.
But Yahya Khan did not let Awami League form a new government.
He made lame excuses.
On 1 March, 1971 he called for National Assembly Session.
Finally he cancelled that also.
Hartals and demontrations continued all over the country.

In response to this call the people of East Pakistan came out on the streets.
All administrative works of East Pakistan were going on at the direction of Bangabandhu.
Realising the seriousness of the situation Yahya Khan came to Dhaka.
But all discussions failed.
Countless students, teachers, police, EPR and ordinary men and women were killed.
On the same night Bangabandhu was arrested from his residence.
On 10 April a temporary government in exile was formed.
The whole nation plunged into Liberation War.
The Bangali civilian patriots helped and inspired the heroic liberation warriors in many ways.
Only a few traitors helped the Pakistanis against the LiberationWar.
During the nine-months long Liberation War thirty lakhs of people were martyred.
Among the martyrs there were many teachers, doctors, artists, journalists and other intellectuals.
The Pakistani soldiers also tortured many people.
But the Invading Forces were defeated in the face of strong determination of the Bangalis.
We achieved victory in the Liberation War.
